Curriculum vitae  
 
Dr. rer. nat. Sascha Wagner  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Personal details:  
 
Name:     Dr. rer. nat. Sascha  Bodo Wagner  
 
Date of birth:     06.07.1975  
Place of birth:    Birkenfeld/Nahe  
 
Domicile:      Niedaltdorfer Straße 23  
     D-66780 Rehli ngen -Siersburg  
     Tel: +49 6833 -901923  
     E-Mail: sascha -wagner@gmx.de  
  
 Family status:   married  
 
 
 
 
Work experience:  
 
 since 12/2015  Proteintech Group  
 
     Account Manager Germany   
      
 
Responsibilities : 
distribution of research reagents and services; maintain and 
develop relationships with existing customers with a view to 
growing long -term and effective business relationships ; visit 
ley customers  at pharmaceutical companies,  biotech  
companies , public research organizations and universities ; 
pro-actively search and connect with new prospects ; use 
core selling skills to provide effective solutions  to 
customers; technical support;  arrange and attend trade 
shows and exhibitions ; liaise with institutional procurement 
departments to facilitate ease of purc hase ; provide 
feedback to Marketing and Product development ; meet ing 
and reporting on annual sales targets ; maintenance of 
customer database (CRM)  
 
 
 02/2008 – 09/2015   tebu-bio GmbH, Offenbach/Main  
 
Technical Sales Representative   
„Biomarkers and Immunoassays Products & Services“  
 
 
 
 
Responsibilities : 
distribution of research reagents and services; negotiations 
of trade agreements; development of business plans; 
identification of market needs; market analyses; 
maintenance and development of customer relations to key 
accounts at pharmaceutical companies,  biotechs, public 
research organizations and universities; scientific 
assistance and consulting; maintenance of customer 
database (CRM)   
 
 
 02/2007 – 01/2008   MARVECS GmbH , Ulm  
 
     Medical Sales Representative  
Astra -Zeneca, Procter & Gamble and Smith & Nephew  
 
 
 
10/2005 – 11/2006   Mikrobiologisches Laboratorium Dr. Jacobs  
 
Scientific Assistant  
 
     Contract research organization for clinical and technical 
     microbiology / Quality control  of pharmaceutical an d  
     medical products   
 
Responsibilities:  
Method development and validation acc. Ph.Eur. and  
USP; test reports; planning and validation of 
microbiological tests;  project planning i n close 
collaboration with cu stomers  
 
 
10/2000 – 09/2005   PhD student / Postdoctoral research fellow  
     University of Saarland Medica l School, Dept. of Virology, 
     Group PD Dr. rer. nat. Klaus Roemer  
 
 
     Dissertation:  
     “The roles of retinoblastoma protein pRb and   
     cell cycle regulator p21 waf1  in the sensitivity of tumor 
     cells to chemopreventive and chemotherapeuti c drugs“  
 
PhD („magna cum laude“)  
 
 
  
 
 
  
   
 
      
Studies:  
 
1994 – 2000  Studies in biology at University of Saarland, Germany  
 Focus on Genetics, Virology and Microbiology  
 
11/1999 – 09/2000  Diploma thesis at the University of Saarland Medical 
School, Dept. of Virology, Group PD Dr. rer. nat . Klaus 
Roemer  
  
“Different cellular responses to chemotherapeutic drugs: 
Mechanisms of p53 -induced apoptosis“  
 
 09/2000    Diplom -Biologe  
 
 
Education:  
 
1981 – 1985    Basic school Rehlingen/Saar  
1985 – 1994    Grammar school Dillingen/Saar  
04.06.19 94   Abitur  
 
 
 
 
Publications:    Wagner S , Roemer K  
     „Retinoblastoma protein is required for efficient  
     colorectal carcinoma cell apoptosis by histone   
     deacetylase inhibitors“  
     Biochemical Pharmacology, 2005; 69: 1059 -1067  
 
     Mahyar - Roemer M, Fritzsche C, Wagner S , Laue  
     M, Roemer K  
     „Mitochondrial p53 levels parallel total p53 levels  
     independent of stress response in human colorectal  
     carcinoma and gl ioblastoma cells“  
     Oncogene, 2004 Aug 19; 23(37): 6226 -36 
 
     Poehland T, Wagner S , Mahyar – Roemer M, Roemer K  
     „Bax and Bak are the critical complementary effectors of 
     colorectal cancer cell apoptosis by chemopreventive  
     resveratrol“  
     Anti-cancer drugs, 2006, 17: 471 - 478

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
